tourBios.curYrHigh: Fully exempt as a 2012 tournament winner and 2012 Order of Merit No. 8
tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Finished the season ranked eighth on the Order of Merit… Had a victory, two top 10s, three top 25s and four cuts made in 10 starts… Earned U.S. $28,425 in prize money… Won the Roberto De Vicenzo Invitational Copa NEC at the San Eliseo G&CC in Buenos Aires, Argentina in mid-October. On his way to a two-stroke victory at the fifth event of the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, he shot 69-72-64-68- for a 15-under 273. His third-round 64 featured a hole-in-one at the eighth hole, a 200-yard par-3, where he hit a 7-iron. At the time, the U.S. $22,500 winner's check vaulted him into the seventh spot of the Order of Merit…His other top 10 was a T8 spot at the season-ending 107th Visa Open de Argentina…Made two cuts in five starts on the Web.com Tour.

2011: Earned his Tour card as the 34th-ranked player on the Tour de las Americas' Order of Merit...Moved to the United States in order to play Web.com Tour qualifiers, several mini tours and the Tour de las Americas, where he collected five top 15s in 10 tournament starts.

2010: Played on the European Challenge Tour. 

2009: Won the Club Colombia Masters. Following that victory, an event also sanctioned by the European Challenge Tour, he spent the remainder of the season playing in Europe. 

2008: Won the Peru Open.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Enjoyed a terrific career as an amateur, representing Argentina in several international events…Finished sixth on the individual competition at the 2006 World Amateur Team Championship

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T was T10th in 2011 at the Mexican PGA Championship.
